title: This England side should be celebrated for what it is – the most diverse squad ever assembled
text:
England’s young and marauding back-row all started at state schools. In all, 22 of Eddie Jones’ World Cup squad did not pay for their education between 11 and 15 – a detail the Rugby Football Union is understandably pleased with as parts of the game strive to become more diverse and less bound by social class.

Rugby union as a game for the wealthy has been an enduring conception in England. And with good reason. Cricket and rugby are the two major sports with the highest imbalances in favour of ‘independent schools’ at international level. In a society where 93 per cent of children are state educated, 43 per cent of men and...
description: England’s young and marauding back-row all started at state schools.
